Baby.Action: Engages in friendly conversation with the busboy, shows genuine curiosity about his smoking habits.
Does not interrupt or judge the busboy despite his nervousness and contradictory statements about smoking.
Lightly teases the busboy about his loyalty to Old Gold cigarettes.
The busboy seems flustered and looks around nervously.
Unable to articulate clearly why they smoke Old Gold, responding with uncertain phrases like 'I guess. I don't know.'
Demonstrates simple habitual reasoning by explaining he smokes Old Gold because they were given for free in the service.
No actions or statements present in the excerpt to assess competence.
